movies.title: Female Prisoner Scorpion: Beast Stable
movies.plot: Sasori is outside the prison and on the run from the police, wanted for breaking out of prison and murder. She takes refuge with a woman who has a brother with a learning disability. The woman and her brother are also involved in an incestuous relationship. Both the police and an ex-prison mate of Sasori's pursue her.
movies.simplePlot: Matsu is sheltered by an incestuous prostitute on her run from the police, her ex-prison mate and a cop whose arm she hacked off.

biography.bio: Meiko Kaji was born on March 24, 1947 in the Kanda area of Tokyo, Japan. Following graduation from the Yakumo Academy High School in Meguro, Tokyo, Japan in 1965, Kaji first began acting in films in the mid-1960's under her real name of Masako Ôta. She was given the stage name Meiko Kaji by director Masahiro Makino. Meiko achieved her greatest enduring cult cinema popularity with her fierce portrayals of various tough outlaw characters which include young rebellious delinquents in the Stray Cat Rock series, the lethal Sasori from the Female Prisoner Scorpion pictures, and, most famously, the ruthless and driven titular assassin in the Lady Snowblood films. Kaji won a plethora of awards for her stand-out performance in Double suicide à Sonezaki (1978). In the 1980's Meiko started acting more on television. Moreover, Kaji has also eked out a career as a singer: She not only sang the haunting theme song "Flower of Carnage (Shura No Hana)" for Lady Snowblood (1973) and the theme song "Urami-Bushi" for Female Prisoner #701: Scorpion (1972), but also has recorded and released several albums and singles. ("Flower of Carnage (Shura No Hana)" and "Urami-Bushi" were both featured on the soundtracks to Kill Bill: Vol. 1 (2003) and Kill Bill: Vol. 2 (2004), respectively.) In addition, Meiko has turned down offers to act in Hollywood movies because she believes she can't give a good performance in a language other than Japanese.
biography.name: Meiko Kaji

biography.bio: Mikio Narita was born on January 31, 1935 in Sakata, Japan. He was an actor, known for The Detective Story (1979), Zatoichi and the Chess Expert (1965) and Female Prisoner Scorpion: Beast Stable (1973). He died on April 9, 1990 in Tokyo, Japan.
biography.name: Mikio Narita

biography.bio: Reisen Ri was born on March 25, 1942 in Tokyo, Japan as Chocha Lee. She is an actress, known for Female Prisoner Scorpion: Beast Stable (1973), Mishima: A Life in Four Chapters (1985) and Summer Soldiers (1972). She was previously married to Juro Kara.
biography.name: Reisen Ri

biography.bio: Yayoi Watanabe was born on August 24, 1952 in Tokyo, Japan. She is an actress, known for Female Prisoner #701: Scorpion (1972), School of the Holy Beast (1974) and Female Prisoner Scorpion: Beast Stable (1973).
biography.name: Yayoi Watanabe

biography.bio: Kôji Nanbara was born on June 7, 1927 in Yokohama, Kanagawa, Japan as Uwaji Itsui. He was an actor, known for Branded to Kill (1967), The Human Condition I: No Greater Love (1959) and The Bad Sleep Well (1960). He died on December 20, 2001 in Chofu, Tokyo, Japan.
biography.name: Kôji Nanbara

biography.bio: Seiya Satô is an actor, known for La marche de Kamata (1982), Female Prisoner Scorpion: Beast Stable (1973) and Zenka onna: koroshi-bushi (1973).
biography.name: Seiya Satô

biography.bio: Takashi Fujiki was born on March 4, 1940 in Shizuoka, Japan as Toshihiko Endo. He is an actor, known for Shin Godzilla (2016), Fleur pâle (1964) and Tears on the Lion's Mane (1962).
biography.name: Takashi Fujiki

biography.bio: Tomoko Mayama was born on January 22, 1941 in Tokyo, Japan. She is an actress, known for Lone Wolf and Cub: Sword of Vengeance (1972), Les six épouses de Ching (1969) and Nagasaki Women's Prison (1971). She was previously married to Yukio Ninagawa.
biography.name: Tomoko Mayama

biography.bio: Mitsuru Mori is an actress and director, known for Female Prisoner Scorpion: Beast Stable (1973), Teppôdama no bigaku (1973) and Neon kurage: Shinjuku hanadensha (1973).
biography.name: Mitsuru Mori

biography.bio: Chie Kobayashi was born on September 30, 1950 in Tokyo, Japan. She is an actress, known for Baby Cart: Le paradis blanc de l'enfer (1974), Female Prisoner #701: Scorpion (1972) and Battles Without Honor and Humanity (1973).
biography.name: Chie Kobayashi

biography.bio: Kôji Fujiyama is an actor, known for Daikaijû kettô: Gamera tai Barugon (1966), Baby Cart: Le paradis blanc de l'enfer (1974) and Lone Wolf and Cub: Sword of Vengeance (1972).
biography.name: Kôji Fujiyama

biography.bio: Kôji Sekiyama was born on May 22, 1929. He is an actor, known for Lone Wolf and Cub: Baby Cart in Peril (1972), A Fugitive from the Past (1965) and Gangster Cop (1970).
biography.name: Kôji Sekiyama

biography.bio: Nobuo Yana was born on August 19, 1935 in Okayama City, Okayama, Japan. He is an actor and writer, known for Izakaya yurei (1994), Himitsu Sentai Gorenger (1975) and All About Our House (2001).
biography.name: Nobuo Yana

biography.bio: Toshiyuki Tsuchiyama is an actor, known for Johnny Sokko and His Flying Robot (1967), Female Prisoner #701: Scorpion (1972) and Female Prisoner Scorpion: Beast Stable (1973).
biography.name: Toshiyuki Tsuchiyama

biography.bio: Hiroshi Date is an actor, known for Female Prisoner Scorpion: Jailhouse 41 (1972), Female Prisoner Scorpion: Beast Stable (1973) and Zenka onna: koroshi-bushi (1973).
biography.name: Hiroshi Date
